revised_title: Controlled Aggregation of Nitrogen in Diamond and Formation of Platelets
tldr: This study describes experiments in which synthetic diamonds containing substantial quantities of nitrogen were heated to cause aggregation, producing all the aggregates found in natural diamonds under controlled conditions. The experiments focused on the formation of platelets, which are found in type 1 natural diamonds in {100} planes. The process involved irradiating the diamonds with electrons to increase the mobility of nitrogen atoms, then heating them under high pressure to promote aggregation. The results provide insights into the conditions under which nitrogen aggregation occurs in natural diamonds.
